Rick explores a city of many identities, boasting a young student population apparently hungry for dishes that reflect the freshest of seafood. Back home, he prepares veal and aubergine stew after meeting the doyenne of Greek cooking, Vafa Alexiadou.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms revisits some of the great British war films that helped boost the nation's morale in the difficult years that followed the end of the Second World War. Among the silver screen gems highlighted are In Which We Serve, Reach for the Sky, Bridge on the River Kwai and The Dam Busters. The programme includes archive interviews with stars including Noel Coward, Richard Attenborough, David Lean, Alec Guinness, Kenneth More and John Mills, and Sylvia shares her memories of filming her own contribution to the genre, Ice Cold in Alex.(n)

programme.title: The Wooden Horse
programme.desc: British PoWs in a German camp try to escape their captors by taking up gymnastics, and using a vaulting horse to conceal the tunnel they are digging. However, even if they manage to escape the camp, the journey to neutral territory will not be an easy one. Fact-based Second World War drama, starring Leo Genn, David Tomlinson, Anthony Steel and David Greene.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Santiago
programme.desc: On the final stretch of the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage, Ed Byrne, JJ Chalmers and the Rev Kate Bottley take a dip in the freezing water within a beautiful wooded valley. Neil Morrissey and Heather Small's snoring means some choose to sleep outside, Debbie McGee battles blisters, while journalist Raphael Rowe discovers it is the company of others that is spurring him on. As they near the end of their journey, it remains to be seen what the experience of re-enacting the 780km pilgrimage has meant to the participants and whether they can identify any lasting change within themselves. Narrated by Lee Ingleby.(n)

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Joe Lycett hosts the semi-final, as the four remaining sewers take on garments and techniques from around the world. Firstly, they must follow a pattern like none they've encountered before, as judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young ask them to make a pair of Indian Dhoti Pants. Next is the Transformation Challenge, as the sewers take on a garment from West Africa, the Dashiki. For their final challenge, the Made to Measure, the semi-finalists take on the fiendishly tricky high-end Japanese couture technique of origami.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The four remaining teams reach the People's Republic of China. Alex has a romantic encounter while working at a flower stall to find the next stage of the journey, Natalie fulfills a childhood dream at a ski resort, tension mounts between Josh and Felix as they trek across the mountains, and Tony and Elaine face an arduous journey by train.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon acquire a boat, planning to use it for coastal patrols, but after setting sail they get lost in fog. When the men finally reach dry land, they believe they have crossed the Channel and landed behind enemy lines. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen: God's Own Comedian
programme.desc: A look at the life, work and legacy of Irish comedy writer and performer Dave Allen, who started his career in entertainment as a Butlin's Redcoat. He first found fame as a chat-show host in Australia in the 1960s, before he came to Britain and began a career that took in films, plays and documentaries alongside his award-winning comedy series. Featuring interviews with family and friends including Steven Berkoff, Stephen Frears and Maggie Smith, as well as rare archive material.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen at Peace
programme.desc: Fact-based drama filmed in the style of the Irish comedian's BBC TV series, following Dave Allen from childhood to becoming one of the UK and Ireland's comedy greats, and exploring how his life and work was shaped by the tragic loss of his father, his brother and half a finger. Starring Aidan Gillen, with Ian McElhinney, Julian Rhind-Tutt, Tommy Tiernan, Pauline McLynn, Simon Day and Conleth Hill.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen: The Immaculate Selection
programme.desc: A compilation of the finest, funniest and most irreverent routines by the Irish comedy writer and performer, known for his combination of laid-back storytelling and anger at social and political hypocrisy. The programme features a selection of BBC archive material originally recorded between 1971 and 1986.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass investigate the 1962 murder of a warehouse employee during an armed robbery, asking whether the man convicted of the crime was innocent.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues a tired rocking chair, old scaffolding poles and a pair of dining chairs from the tip, enlisting Kev Paxton and Simion Hawton-Smith to help transform them.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Eltham Palace, and explores the art deco wing that was built in the 1930s. Items brought in to be valued include a pair of duelling pistols with a story to tell, two rare Fijian war clubs, and a panel of stained glass from the Houses of Parliament which was broken during the Blitz.

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: On what should be the day Britain leaves the European Union, Jo Coburn and BBC correspondents offer an update on politics from Westminster and beyond.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates food served to British monarchs from the time of George IV to the reign of the present Queen.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The desire to escape the daily grind and head off on holiday is something many people crave - but why do so many still make a beeline for the beach? Nick Crane and the rest of the Coast team embark on a quest to find out. He begins by following a centuries-old tourist trail to Margate, revealing that the beach has a biological effect on people's stress levels. Miranda Krestovnikoff experiences a camping safari on Shell Island in north Wales and Ruth Goodman finds out about an explosive episode of pre-war politics that put sleepy St Leonards on the front pages.

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Neighbours Ilona Watson and Fay Baxter started a community cafe to help bring their divided village in Rogiet, Monmouthshire, together. Ilona's husband Andy is severely disabled after a fall and Fay looks after her elderly mother who has advanced dementia. Presenters Paul Martin and Tim Weeks ask local residents to donate unwanted items to sell at a street auction so that the two unsuspecting women can be treated to a short break away.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones goes back to the 1960s to hear the story of an inspirational woman who was lucky enough to experience an idyllic and carefree childhood in a beautiful seaside village in Cornwall. In stark contrast to her own upbringing, she meets a family living in east London who have never been outside the capital, or even seen the sea.

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: David Harper v Philip Serrell - Showdown
programme.desc: Experts Philip Serrell and David Harper near the end of their week-long battle, competing over four different locations to find the best antiques to turn a profit on. It's a tense affair as they approach the showdown auction.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer and actor Jordan Stephens, presenter and actor Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, vying to be crowned weekly champion.

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Chris Bavin heads to Petworth in West Sussex to meet a group of residents entering Bloom for the first time who are hoping to get a disconnected community working together. These Bloomers want to engage the whole area, from the historic town centre to the modern housing estates on the outskirts, in an effort to bring the community spirit back to their neighbourhood.

programme.title: Scrum V Live
programme.desc: Cardiff v Bridgend (Kick-off 7.10pm). Catrin Heledd is joined by Richie Rees and Matthew Rees to present coverage of the Principality Premiership clash, which takes place at Cardiff Arms Park. When these teams faced each other at Brewery Field in November of last year, Cardiff recorded an emphatic 36-0 victory, despite Cardiff being hampered early in the first half after Sam Pailor was sent to the sin bin for a ruck infringement. The contest proved to be an error-strewn one, but the visitors showed the better quality at key moments, especially in the second half when they scored three tries courtesy of Will Rees-Hole, Tom Daley and Morgan Allen.

programme.title: Australia: Earth's Magical Kingdom
programme.desc: An exploration how native creatures have adapted to survive in the human environment. In Melbourne, tree-dwelling possums have taken to sharing trees in city parks, risking encounters with traffic and cats. In Brisbane's parks, over the past 150 years of so, eastern water dragons have become twice the size of their wild cousins and without trees to climb their limbs are getting longer and claws shorter. Beyond the cities, dingoes eek out an existence in the inhospitable environment of a desert goldmine, while climate change and deforestation is posing a threat to koalas. Narrated by Barry Humphries. Last in the series.

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: New series. The comedian tries to help make sense of bewildering times as he dissects the week's news using stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction. Featuring contributions from Sara Pascoe, Lucy Prebble and a variety of comic guests.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark provides the latest Brexit analysis, plus an overview of international news stories.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: My Scientology Movie
programme.desc: The reporter investigates the controversial religious organisation, but finds himself denied access to anyone involved. Adopting a different approach, he resorts to recruiting actors to re-enact the personal stories of former members - only to find his project is under surveillance by representatives of the church.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Bronagh Munro examines the shocking way some academy trusts are running schools, exposing one where the boss employed relatives and whose pupils claim they were taught how to cheat on exams. She also investigates an academy trust that pays its managers big salaries, while unpaid bills and disconnection notices pile up in the classroom.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Knockout week comes to a close as the 10 remaining cooks are split into two teams of five. Their challenge is to create a three-course meal in relay, with no communication allowed. They have 20 minutes each, in which time they all have to plan, create and cook a starter featuring scallops, a main course with chicken and a dessert celebrating brown sugar. The winners will automatically become semi-finalists, while the other five have to fight it out again next week to earn their place. Presented by John Torode and Gregg Wallace.(n)

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Part two of two. The horticultural enthusiast explores Japan during autumn. He begins as he did in the spring, at one of the `three great gardens of Japan' to learn how they are protected from the coming winter. Monty follows the history of the Japanese garden through the military strongholds of past leaders to the many styles, new and old, of the iconic stroll garden and finds a slice of Victorian England in the heart of Tokyo. He also learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle. He ends his journey by the Sea of Japan at a place that makes art out of its gardens.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place: Asia
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and his CBBC mates discover a primate rescue centre in Vietnam, explore nomadic areas of Mongolia's capital Ulaan Baatar and pay tribute to ELO in the city of Shanghai.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood show more clips from the natural world, including a toad that grows its babies on its back, and a two-headed snake.(n)

programme.title: Absolute Genius with Dick & Dom
programme.desc: Richard McCourt and Dominic Wood reveal the genius of astronomer Caroline Herschel, who was the first person to spot a comet in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Top Class
programme.desc: Susan Calman presents as Greenland Community Primary School from County Durham take on St Michael's Church of England Primary School from Manchester.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Ate My Homework
programme.desc: Team captains Tiah and Noah compete in the children's comedy panel show hosted by Iain Stirling, featuring studio-based frolics and slapstick challenges. Featuring special guests Matthew Crosby, Lauren Layfield, Dominique Moore and Saima Chowdhury.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60 on a Mission
programme.sub-title: Deadly on a Mission: Pole to Pole: Shark Island
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team travel to Guadalupe Island, 150 miles off the Mexican coast, where he swims alongside a great white shark - without the protection of a cage. Diving into the crystal clear sea, the presenter discovers the creatures are attracted by Guadalupe fur seals, whose underwater speed and agility is no match for the fearsome predator. The presenter returns to the boat and, with a great white shark circling the vessel, prepares to step out into the blue abyss for an encounter he will never forget.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Microworlds
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the Namib in south-west Africa, the oldest desert in the world. With little to no rainfall, the animals that live here have to be tough and Steve examines the tactics that each employs to cope with the harsh conditions, before revealing the secret that allows life to survive at all in such an environment.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox explores how the development of mankind and the history of the universe are intertwined, visiting dramatic locations around the world to illustrate the fundamental scientific principles that govern the laws of nature. He begins by investigating time, charting the evolution of the cosmos and explaining why the universe must one day come to an end.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a one-bedroom flat high on potential in London's Streatham, a coastal bungalow in Cumbria and a semi-detached property near Derby with scope for an extension. The hosts see what each went for at auction and talk to the new owners' about their plans for their aquisitions.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef heads to the north-eastern Greek city of Thessaloniki, which nestles on the northern shores of the Aegean Sea. The city is revered as the gourmet capital of Greece and birthplace to possibly the greatest warrior general that ever lived - Alexander. Rick explores a city of many identities, boasting a young student population apparently hungry for dishes that reflect the freshest of seafood. Back home, he prepares veal and aubergine stew after meeting the doyenne of Greek cooking, Vafa Alexiadou.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms revisits some of the great British war films that helped boost the nation's morale in the difficult years that followed the end of the Second World War. Among the silver screen gems highlighted are In Which We Serve, Reach for the Sky, Bridge on the River Kwai and The Dam Busters. The programme includes archive interviews with stars including Noel Coward, Richard Attenborough, David Lean, Alec Guinness, Kenneth More and John Mills, and Sylvia shares her memories of filming her own contribution to the genre, Ice Cold in Alex.(n)

programme.title: The Wooden Horse

However, even if they manage to escape the camp, the journey to neutral territory will not be an easy one. Fact-based Second World War drama, starring Leo Genn, David Tomlinson, Anthony Steel and David Greene.(n)

programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Santiago
programme.desc: On the final stretch of the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage, Ed Byrne, JJ Chalmers and the Rev Kate Bottley take a dip in the freezing water within a beautiful wooded valley. Neil Morrissey and Heather Small's snoring means some choose to sleep outside, Debbie McGee battles blisters, while journalist Raphael Rowe discovers it is the company of others that is spurring him on. As they near the end of their journey, it remains to be seen what the experience of re-enacting the 780km pilgrimage has meant to the participants and whether they can identify any lasting change within themselves. Narrated by Lee Ingleby.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as experts Will Axon and Thomas Plant value items at London Zoo in Regent's Park.(n)

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.sub-title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast: Beaumaris to Red Wharf Bay
programme.desc: Derek Brockway fires the starting cannon at the Beaumaris Regatta on Anglesey, then embarks on a 14-mile walk initially taking him into the town's heavily fortified castle before heading onto the Welsh Coast Path. Derek visits the hamlet of Penmon, before heading to the photogenic Black Nose lighthouse with views over Puffin Island. The walk turns inland for a couple of miles before arriving at a new stretch of path, which has been moved much closer to the headland with fine sea views. Derek's eventual destination is Red Wharf Bay, a wide sandy bay on the east coast of the island.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four contestants to brave the black chair to answer question on their specialised subjects. of 1970s pop, politician Neville Chamberlain, ancient Greek city Sparta and writer CS Lewis. They are then each afforded two minutes to demonstrate their prowess on general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, though it remains to be seen whether they have successfully taken on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge record producer Pete Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets busy on the vegetable plot and takes the next step in planting up his new Paradise Garden. With Mothering Sunday around the corner, he also provides some timely inspiration for planting up a spring pot as a present. Frances Tophill is thrilled to have her own allotment this year, and here shares her plans for the season ahead, making a start on getting it shipshape. The programme also visits the alpine house at RHS Garden Wisley to find out from the experts how they care for some of the smallest and most colourful spring gems.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon acquire a boat, planning to use it for coastal patrols, but after setting sail they get lost in fog. When the men finally reach dry land, they believe they have crossed the Channel and landed behind enemy lines. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen: God's Own Comedian
programme.desc: A look at the life, work and legacy of Irish comedy writer and performer Dave Allen, who started his career in entertainment as a Butlin's Redcoat. He first found fame as a chat-show host in Australia in the 1960s, before he came to Britain and began a career that took in films, plays and documentaries alongside his award-winning comedy series. Featuring interviews with family and friends including Steven Berkoff, Stephen Frears and Maggie Smith, as well as rare archive material.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen at Peace
programme.desc: Fact-based drama filmed in the style of the Irish comedian's BBC TV series, following Dave Allen from childhood to becoming one of the UK and Ireland's comedy greats, and exploring how his life and work was shaped by the tragic loss of his father, his brother and half a finger. Starring Aidan Gillen, with Ian McElhinney, Julian Rhind-Tutt, Tommy Tiernan, Pauline McLynn, Simon Day and Conleth Hill.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen: The Immaculate Selection
programme.desc: A compilation of the finest, funniest and most irreverent routines by the Irish comedy writer and performer, known for his combination of laid-back storytelling and anger at social and political hypocrisy. The programme features a selection of BBC archive material originally recorded between 1971 and 1986.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: A lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.sub-title: I Slept With Your Brother but I Hope You're the Dad! DNA Results
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford present a lively mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quizzy McQuizface, a team of pub quizzers from Scotland, answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Jude, Kimya, Ricardo and Tom pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel is furious with Arthur, Vanessa and Charity make amends, and Billy finds a new lease of life.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Daniel and Sinead bring Bertie home from hospital, Gary's good fortune proves short-lived and Sarah blames Seb for vandalising her partner's van. Meanwhile, Wayne's questions fuel the speculation surrounding Carla, and Robert wastes no time in replacing Ryan at the Bistro.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's the day of the Little Crosby Folk Festival and organiser Toby Winning is found dead, having drowned in a bowl of eggs and live eels. The murder seems to have been inspired by a ballad made famous by the late, lamented star Johnny Carver. Then it comes to light the victim recently announced plans to move the event to a new location, which would have cost local entrepreneur Frank Wainwright dearly. Toby's estranged wife Alice also comes under suspicion, before two further killings take place, echoing more lyrics from the song.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined this week by Hollywood stars Colin Farrell and Danny DeVito, who will soon be appearing in Tim Burton's new live-action remake of classic Disney animation Dumbo. Also dropping into the studio are double Olympic boxing champion Nicola Adams, and actress and stand-up comedian Lolly Adefope, recently seen in This Time with Alan Patridge and who kicks off a UK tour in Glasgow this week. Scottish singer-songwriter Lewis Capaldi completes the guest list, performing his number one single Someone You Loved.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five from Bath dubbed the Eager Beaverstocks answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: All Star Mr & Mrs
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield is joined by Loose Women anchor Kaye Adams and her husband Ian, actress Sue Holderness (Only Fools and Horses) and husband Mark, and former Strictly Come Dancing professional Vincent Simone with his fiancee Susan. The contestants find out how much they really know about their other halves, and the couple who give the most correct answers to a series of questions receive the chance to win £30,000 for their chosen charity. However, no one walks away empty-handed - the losing pairs each receive £5,000 for a good cause.(n)

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.(n)

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.(n)

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Agent Kym's next mission takes her to a fire station where she walks in the shoes of the brave firefighters there.(n)

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The lovable halfwit unknowingly takes a monkey home in his car after visiting a safari park. After hearing on the news that the monkey has been `stolen', Bean realises he must return him without getting into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Scrambled
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.(n)

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.(n)

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.sub-title: Man Up 3: The Good, the Bad, and the Manly
programme.desc: After Bubbles gets blasted with Man Boy's beard ray, she wreaks havoc in the most manly and adorable way possible.(n)

programme.title: ToonMarty
programme.desc: Burnie is upset after getting a terrible haircut, but his troubles aren't over yet - now all of his hair clippings are going on a crime spree!(n)

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.(n)

programme.title: Teen Titans Go
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by singer Max George and chef Jun Tanaka. On the menu are pan-fried steak with leeks and taleggio, homemade marshmallows, and halibut with lobster sauce.(n)

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott concludes his culinary tour of Antigua, picking up some of the island's famous black pineapples from a fruit and vegetable stall to make a lobster pina colada with rum, and visiting a hilltop cookery school, where he makes a rum butter cake. The Carribean tour concludes at the famous sunset party at Shirley Heights, where he prepares one last cocktail recipe. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The travelling chef ventures into Louisiana's state capital Baton Rouge to experience a unique American phenomenon - tailgating. It's the day of a big football match at Louisiana State University, and the LSU Tigers are playing in front of thousands of fans. Surrounded by people barbecuing, cooking and sharing food from the back of their pick-up trucks, James joins in and cooks up a storm ahead of the game. He also takes time out to visit a Baton Rouge-based oyster restaurant specialising in North American varieties.(n)

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: James Bond's investigation into the murder of three British agents leads him to a connection between the dictator of a Caribbean island and a notorious Harlem drug kingpin - along with a plot to flood America with limitless supplies of free heroin. Spy adventure, with Roger Moore in his first appearance as 007, alongside Yaphet Kotto and Jane Seymour.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Pets
programme.desc: Premiere. When rivalry leaves them cast adrift on the streets of New York, two bickering hounds must put their differences aside and pull together. Animated adventure from the makers of Despicable Me, featuring the voices of Louis CK, Eric Stonestreet and Kevin Hart.(n)

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh returns with the celebrity version of the team quiz show. As ever, four star contestants are challenged to pit their wits against one of the show's ruthless quiz experts, in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for their charity of choice. This time, Absolute Radio's Christian O'Connell, singer, TV presenter and vocal coach Carrie Grant, Channel 5 children's presenter Naomi Wilkinson and I, Daniel Blake star Dave Johns each try to race down the game board without being caught, before joining forces for the final chase.(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the live semi-final, which begins by revealing which act has won the lifeline vote. The remaining performers selected by coaches Jennifer Hudson, Will.i.am, Tom Jones and Olly Murs must now give it their all if they are to win one of the four remaining places in next week's final, where they ill compete for the chance to win a recording contract. The decision over who will be going through to the last round and who will be leaving the show tonight lies entirely with the votes of the viewing public.(n)

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Westlife, who have recently reformed for a 20th anniversary tour. Also dropping in to the studio are Love Island winner Dani Dyer, comedian Desiree Burch, and Line of Duty stars Vicky McClure and Adrian Dunbar, soon to be seen in a fifth series of the acclaimed crime drama.(n)

programme.title: The 40 Year-Old Virgin
programme.desc: A middle-aged shop worker reveals he has never been intimate with a woman, which prompts his shocked colleagues to set him up with a series of potentially passionate dates. When he falls for a single mother, his friends think he is right on course for a lusty liaison, but his new partner is not ready for a physical relationship. Judd Apatow's comedy, starring Steve Carell, Catherine Keener and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder

programme.title: Tenable

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel is furious with Arthur, Vanessa and Charity make amends, and Billy finds a new lease of life.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Daniel and Sinead bring Bertie home from hospital, Gary's good fortune proves short-lived and Sarah blames Seb for vandalising her partner's van. Meanwhile, Wayne's questions fuel the speculation surrounding Carla, and Robert wastes no time in replacing Ryan at the Bistro.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's the day of the Little Crosby Folk Festival and organiser Toby Winning is found dead, having drowned in a bowl of eggs and live eels. The murder seems to have been inspired by a ballad made famous by the late, lamented star Johnny Carver. Then it comes to light the victim recently announced plans to move the event to a new location, which would have cost local entrepreneur Frank Wainwright dearly. Toby's estranged wife Alice also comes under suspicion, before two further killings take place, echoing more lyrics from the song.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined this week by Hollywood stars Colin Farrell and Danny DeVito, who will soon be appearing in Tim Burton's new live-action remake of classic Disney animation Dumbo. Also dropping into the studio are double Olympic boxing champion Nicola Adams, and actress and stand-up comedian Lolly Adefope, recently seen in This Time with Alan Patridge and who kicks off a UK tour in Glasgow this week. Scottish singer-songwriter Lewis Capaldi completes the guest list, performing his number one single Someone You Loved.(n)

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five from Bath dubbed the Eager Beaverstocks answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: All Star Mr & Mrs
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield is joined by Loose Women anchor Kaye Adams and her husband Ian, actress Sue Holderness (Only Fools and Horses) and husband Mark, and former Strictly Come Dancing professional Vincent Simone with his fiancee Susan. The contestants find out how much they really know about their other halves, and the couple who give the most correct answers to a series of questions receive the chance to win £30,000 for their chosen charity. However, no one walks away empty-handed - the losing pairs each receive £5,000 for a good cause.(n)

programme.desc: The lovable halfwit unknowingly takes a monkey home in his car after visiting a safari park. After hearing on the news that the monkey has been `stolen', Bean realises he must return him without getting into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott concludes his culinary tour of Antigua, picking up some of the island's famous black pineapples from a fruit and vegetable stall to make a lobster pina colada with rum, and visiting a hilltop cookery school, where he makes a rum butter cake. The Carribean tour concludes at the famous sunset party at Shirley Heights, where he prepares one last cocktail recipe. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The travelling chef ventures into Louisiana's state capital Baton Rouge to experience a unique American phenomenon - tailgating. It's the day of a big football match at Louisiana State University, and the LSU Tigers are playing in front of thousands of fans. Surrounded by people barbecuing, cooking and sharing food from the back of their pick-up trucks, James joins in and cooks up a storm ahead of the game. He also takes time out to visit a Baton Rouge-based oyster restaurant specialising in North American varieties.(n)

programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host the words and numbers game show. Mark Pougatch is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Carla asks Sam to talk her impetuous teenage son out of rushing into a premature marriage, while Cliff grows a potato that looks like former US president Richard Nixon.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Andy, the ex-convict who once tried to murder Diane, makes an unwelcome return, sending her natural paranoia into overdrive. Comedy, starring Shelley Long and Ted Danson.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: I Will Gladly Pay You Tuesday
programme.desc: Diane borrows $500 from Sam to buy a book signed by Ernest Hemingway and allows him to look after it as security for the money - but things do not go as planned.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part one of two. Niles throws a fancy-dress Halloween party with a literary theme as a benefit for the Library Association, which he attends dressed as Cyrano de Bergerac, while a misunderstanding lets one or two skeletons out of the closet. Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce star.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part two of two. Roz panics at the thought of becoming a mother, prompting Frasier to lend her a friendly shoulder to cry on - while he ponders the father's identity. Award-winning comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Peri Gilpin.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Special episode filmed on location in Seattle. Frasier is guest of honour at a public rally to mark his 1,000th radio show - but the celebrations go awry as Niles's jealousy reaches new peaks. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray worries Debra's criticism will make the children think he is a fool, and hatches a plan to win back their respect.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray refuses to take Debra to an awards ceremony, tired of her constant lateness, while Frank and Robert get into their own heated debate about the importance of punctuality. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton, Peter Boyle and Doris Roberts.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Queens, New York, where he meets a family torn apart by the stress of running failing Greek restaurant Kati Allo. Husband-and-wife owners Manny and Christine are on the brink of divorce, while their daughter Evelyn is caught in the middle and at her wits' end.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Four people host dinner parties in Portsmouth and Southampton, with Lucy, Elena, Tony and Phil battling it out to impress one another and win the £1,000 cash prize. Kicking off is ladette Lucy who's hoping to wow her guests with a Greek-inspired meal. However, things don't go to plan when flaws are spotted by feisty Elena and Syrian-born Tony.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to East Sussex in their hunt to discover valuable items `lost' in people's homes, with their finds including some Victorian street lamps.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Dictionary Corner guest Jenny Eclair joins Nick Hewer, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent for the words-and-numbers game.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Berkshire charity worker Lynda Feymor has travelled all over the world, but it's Portugal's beautiful Eastern Algarve that's captured her heart. With a budget of £175,000, Jasmine Harman scours every nook and cranny of the local market to find five properties, but can any of them give Lynda the `feeling' she is searching for?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Stephanie finishes her mother Isobel's apartment. Painted and decorated, it now has her fathers framed pictures on the walls, a stunning 200-year-old mahogany canopy, plus furniture. Elsewhere, Jayne and Steve finish the Oriental Room and are ready to take in guests. Last in the series.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores, with Adam Borton and Holly Syme from the Somerset House Hotel keen to put Belinda and Brenda's sleeping issues to bed.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final day in the Midlands, business owner Ian hopes to scoop the prize by whisking his guests off to the Canary Islands. However, having cremated the first course, he must stomach a large portion of blunt feedback.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Halloween special. Bart and Lisa help extraterrestrials phone home - until the aliens' plans are revealed. Homer and Marge play the title characters when they parody the film Mr & Mrs Smith.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Olliers from Stenhousemuir in Scotland, where husband and wife Steven and Mhairi are undecided whether to sell their home or renovate it. Kirstie produces a plan that revolutionises the whole house, while Phil is tasked to find them a home that's a short throw away from their beloved cricket club.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Shows including The Dirt, Catchpoint, Race Across the World, This Morning, and Married at First Sight are subjected to the householders' instant reactions. Narrated by Craig Cash.

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Aisling Bea and Stacey Dooley join Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. As usual, the hashtag £isitok paves the way for the gang to round up, examine and explain the leading and most entertaining news stories of the week. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Big Narstie Show
programme.desc: Guests Zawe Ashton, Sue Perkins, Matt Lucas, Rickie Haywood-Williams, Melvin Odoom and Ms Banks join the grime MC and co-host Mo the Comedian for another round of chat and music.

programme.title: 30 Days of Night
programme.desc: A horde of vampires finds the perfect hunting ground - a town in Alaska that remains sunless for a month. The local sheriff heads up a small band of townsfolk as they try to avoid the bloodthirsty invaders and survive until the sun rises once again. Horror, with Josh Hartnett, Danny Huston and Melissa George.(n)

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: Sami anxiously awaits his substantive interview at the Home Office, and the rest of the family is in meltdown. To distract him, Katy asks Sami to present a talk at her school, which turns into an opportunity for Sami to earn some cash in hand. In return, he decides to clear the air with Peter, and to help Katy and John by taking them to meet new friends at the refugee centre. Comedy, written by and starring Rufus Jones.(n)

programme.title: Traitors
programme.desc: The American intelligence agency is now under the far more ruthless leadership of Caspar. Feef tries to persuade Priscilla to change sides and Jackson to flee for his life while he still can - but his concern for his family makes him stay. In desperation, Feef turns to Sullivan, offering to help MI5 catch the mole in return for their protection. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 Dispatches
programme.desc: Datshiane Navanayagam reveals the shocking conditions that tenants of one of Britain's biggest social landlords are being forced to live in. A year-long investigation finds that Sanctuary Housing left family homes in disrepair and uncovers evidence that this had a critical impact on the health of some of their most vulnerable tenants. As the housing association has grown, official channels of complaint have failed to force it to act reasonably, leaving residents feeling voiceless. In desperation they've turned to social media to share their experiences and offer support. Dispatches asks: are housing associations the new landlords from hell?(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Shirley reconnected with her childhood sweetheart David a few years ago, and now they want to buy their first home together in Cornwall. Sara Damergi and Kerr Drummond offer advice to the couple, finding he wants to live by the beach while she loves the countryside.(n)

programme.title: All Star Driving School
programme.desc: The Vamps bassist Connor Ball tries various distraction techniques to see him through his test. Tattoo Fixers receptionist Paisley Billings is keen to keep her nerves under control.(n)

programme.title: The £100k Drop
programme.desc: Davina McCall is joined by siblings Cath and Alex from Cardiff and Roy and James, a grandfather and grandson from Leeds. Each pair starts off with £100,000 and must avoid wrong answers or bundles of their cash will fall through trapdoors.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra wants to buy an expensive dress for Ally to wear to a friend's 13th birthday party, but Ray refuses to spend $250 on something that will only be used once, and naturally Marie takes his side. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Madylin Sweeten.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert contemplates leaving the police force to take up a job selling security systems, but the proposal receives a mixed reaction, leading to tense celebrations at his birthday party. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Brad Garrett and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink is asked to be a guest speaker on an all-star cruise, and invites the family to accompany him. However, the so-called celebrities also appearing are not exactly famous. Meanwhile, Niles's marital problems worsen once he discovers Maris will also be coming along.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio psychiatrist begins dating a successful lawyer, but it is not long before conflicting career demands start to get in the way of their relationship. Comedy, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon leaves for Texas when his sister goes into labour. While he is away, the rest of the friends decorate for Christmas and reflect on how much he has changed their lives. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes an important decision after Leonard tries to help her in the aftermath of a failed role on a TV show. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart practise talking to strangers at a shopping centre, and Sheldon studies to become a comic genius. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Meanwhile, Leonard struggles to be supportive of his girlfriend's career decision, Bernadette seeks Stuart's help in replacing one of Howard's comic books, and Howard and Raj provide Amy with some advice. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tries to make friends with a new girl at school who turns out to be a terrible bully - prompting her to look for a remedy for antisocial behaviour. Meanwhile, Homer gets into the child safety business.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and the family win a once-in-a-lifetime safari trip to Africa, where they encounter tribesmen, jungle animals - and the secretive owner of a chimpanzee refuge.(n)

programme.title: Heineken Champions Cup Rugby: The Big Tackle
programme.desc: Ayo Akinwolere and Lee McKenzie are joined by Bryan Habana and Lee McKenzie at Murrayfield to look ahead to the quarter-final between Edinburgh and Munster.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The same day is shown from three different perspectives as Bart is pursued by gangsters, Lisa makes a bid to win the school science fair with a talkative robot, and Marge accidentally slices off Homer's thumb. Featuring the guest voices of Frankie Muniz and Joe Mantegna.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer helps Ned build a Christian amusement park called Praiseland as a lasting monument to Maude Flanders. Unfortunately, it meets with an unenthusiastic response - until a seemingly genuine miracle occurs.(n)

programme.title: Heineken Champions Cup Rugby Union
programme.desc: Edinburgh v Munster (Kick-off 12.45pm). Coverage of the quarter-final clash, which takes place at Murrayfield, and will see the winners progress to a semi-final contest against either Saracens or Glasgow Warriors. Edinburgh qualified for the last eight after topping Pool Five with a record of five wins and one loss from their six fixtures, While Munster won four, drew one and lost one, on the way to winning Pool Two. Lee McKenzie presents, with analysis from Jim Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition gets underway at the Castellor B&B on Anglesey, where owners Neil and Lavinia Walker's attempt to impress their guests is hampered by a row at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Marlow Lodge in Blackpool, where owner Deano Whiting prides himself on delivering the fun factor. However, guests are unimpressed with the budget facilities.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host this week is manager James Hall and owner's son Adam Neale of The Black Swan in Horsham St Faith, a luxury-roomed establishment with onsite restaurant and pub.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Bleak House in Broadstairs, Kent, run by sisters Nina and Nicola Hilton, whose hopes of success are dashed when Lavinia questions the room prices.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet again to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Castellor owners Neil and Lavinia want help digesting Nicola and Nina's breakfast comments, Deano of Marlow Lodge wants to mop up Neil and Lavinia's cleanliness scores and James and Adam from The Black Swan seeks to get to grips with their hosting score from Deano.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary using close-up camera technology to reveal the behaviour of the animals at Chester Zoo. Giant otter couple Diego and Icana are the best of friends but have never mated, so keepers hope a new male will have what it takes to relight Icana's fire. Blue morpho butterflies Macuna and Peanut also need to mate, but when their diet of fruit ferments and turns to alcohol, their drunken behaviour might dash Chester's hopes of producing the next generation of butterflies. Cameras also follow the relationship between mum-and-daughter Andrean bears Lima and Madidi, who are fighting over food and personal space. Can the youngster learn to respect her elder?(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1: Bahrain Grand Prix Qualifying Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the battle for pole position ahead of the second round of the season, which takes place at the Bahrain International Circuit in Sakhir. Sebastian Vettel recorded a new track record on the way to securing the front position on the starting grid last year, with then-teammate Kimi Raikkonen claiming second place. Steve Jones presents, with analysis from David Coulthard and Billy Monger.(n)

programme.title: Mission Ignition
programme.desc: New series. Two teams of motoring enthusiasts, advised by Take That's Howard Donald and IndyCar champion Dario Franchitti, are challenged to reassemble a classic car from components. The first group to rebuild the vehicle and start the engine gets to keep it. The first episode features three members of the British Women's Racing driver club working on a Porsche 944 and three race car instructors from Bedford assembling a Lotus Elan.(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hitman Arthur Bishop's arch-enemy Crain kidnaps his new girlfriend Gina and blackmails him into committing three assassinations in as many days, while making them look like accidents. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Jessica Alba, Sam Hazeldine and Tommy Lee Jones.(n)

programme.title: Transporter 3
programme.desc: Underworld courier Frank Martin's latest assignment involves transporting the kidnapped daughter of a crooked government minister across Europe on behalf of an eco-terrorist faction. However, a device will kill him if he leaves his car, thugs employed by the politician are out to murder him, and his passenger has a bad case of Stockholm syndrome. Action thriller sequel, with Jason Statham and Natalya Rudakova.(n)

programme.desc: Premiere. Regina, the long-lost niece of amateur sleuth Aurora's boyfriend Martin, turns up with husband and baby. Before her uncle has a chance to reconnect with her, she disappears leaving a dead spouse on the balcony and her baby hidden in Aurora's bathtub. Aurora and Martin's investigation leads them to Regina's home, where locals express bewilderment when told of the existence of Regina's baby. Aurora works on balancing her relationship with Martin with her efforts to solve the murder of the baby's father and the disappearance of his mother. Mystery drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure.

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: New series. Craig Charles, Jon Bentley, Ortis Deley and Georgie Barrat visit the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, where rollable television screens and foldable phones are just two of the mindboggling technological advances on offer. Matthew Griffin explains why 11K TV, robotic skin, domestic holograms and cancer-diagnosing apps may well be available in the next few years, while Harry Wallop reveals how to acquire one of the biggest phones of 2019 - the Samsung Galaxy S10 - at the best possible price. Plus, gaming guru Jordan Erica Webber identifies the video games to look out for in the year ahead.

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.sub-title: Paddington Station: The Big Weekend Getaway
programme.desc: The great Easter escape brings chaos to Paddington, meaning customer ambassador Natalie has to work flat out to help passengers get their long weekend off to a smooth start. Meanwhile, Bristol's entire signal control is being relocated to a state-of-the-art centre in Didcot, which means upgrading some old towers and marks the end of the line for a box that has controlled some of Bristol's signals for half a century.

programme.title: Eamonn & Ruth: How the Other Half Lives
programme.desc: In the second of two programmes, Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford meet the who's who of Britain's rich list to work out their secret rules. Jacqueline Gold, the extraordinary force behind Ann Summers, welcomes them into her luxury home to explain the importance of having a revolutionary idea. She also teaches Ruth the ins-and-outs of hosting the perfect sex toy party. Then duo then meet millionaire philanthropist Jack Petchey, still working hard at the age of 91, to learn how much of the secret is simply hard graft. Plus, the man who claims to be the highest paid life coach in the UK offers some advice.

programme.title: The Royal Family at War
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary charting the scandalous love affairs, bitter disputes and royal rifts throughout the history of the monarchy. They include the public marriage breakdown of Prince Charles and Diana, Princess of Wales, and rumours of a feud between Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton. Plus, the crisis caused by Edward VIII's abdication in 1936 - and the details of the row between his bride Wallis Simpson and the Queen Mother.

programme.title: Britain's Favourite Crisps
programme.desc: A countdown of the nation's 20 most popular flavours and brands of crisps. Celebrities share their thoughts on the top 20 and reminisce on classic TV adverts. Plus, a visit to the world's largest crisp factory and a competitive eater getting to grips with the ultimate crisp butty.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: An infection threatens to sweep through the chimpanzees, prompting the keepers to begin urgent action to save their lives. Meanwhile, the overweight orang-utans continue with their diet and the lemurs are introduced to the stump-tailed macaques before they move in together.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Young chimp Ben's mysterious bacterial infection causes him to lose a toe, while another primate in Hananya's house is struck down by the same illness. Capuchin TJ settles in well with the ladies and his South American housemates learn how to forage for food. Members of staff hide hard-boiled eggs for the capuchins to find and animal director Jeremy has a run-in with female orangutan Lingga.

programme.title: Animal House
programme.desc: Documentary series shining a spotlight on the staff at SPCA Auckland, who dedicate their days to the care and protection of the region's animals. From an injured penguin in need of first aid, to a litter of kittens trapped inside a wall, these compassionate professionals are committed to the rescue, rehabilitation, and adoption of animals in distress.

programme.title: Animal House

programme.title: Babylon 5

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Concerns grow when Callen and Sam fail to show up to work and their colleagues soon learn that the duo's investigation into an anonymous tip led to them being caught in a carefully laid trap hatched by an Isis terrorist cell. Will they be able to get to the pair before it's too late? Drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A 15-year-old paddleboarder is abducted, and the team faces a race against time to find her as she is not carrying medication for a heart condition. Meanwhile, Governor Denning introduces a new recruit, who is given the task of making sure her colleagues abide by the new rules. Captain Vince Fryer from Internal Affairs interrogates Kono and reaches an unpopular view on her career in the force.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the death of Navy Seal member Max Garcia after Joe White raises suspicions about the original verdict of suicide. Meanwhile, Chin Ho grows concerned about the company Kono has been keeping since being kicked off the force. Guest starring William Baldwin.

programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates animals from Australia and Asia, meeting Komodo dragons, orang-utans and giant pandas as he explores why these creatures all came to be supersized.

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Futurama

programme.title: Futurama

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa enters a singing competition on the Krusty the Clown Show and makes it through to the final stages, but Homer's competitive streak threatens to sabotage her performance. Guest starring American Idol 2004 winner Fantasia Barrino as Lisa's rival Clarissa Wellington.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer watches a film about the apocalypse and becomes convinced the end of the world is imminent. Panic-stricken, he begins urging the people of Springfield to join him in preparing to meet their maker - but his dire predictions prove wildly inaccurate.

programme.desc: Bart feels neglected when Homer and Lisa bond over To Kill a Mockingbird and start spending quality time together, so Marge tries to help her husband divide his attentions equally.

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

Also featuring the voices of Robert Wagner and David Silverman.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge tries to bring culture to Springfield by asking architect Frank Gehry (guest starring as himself) to construct a concert hall. programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is committed to a mental institution by an exasperated Marge, who refuses to believe his improbable tales about befriending a mysterious roofing contractor and fears he is finally cracking up. With the guest voices of Ray Romano and Stephen Hawking.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.
