programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kevin realises he will lose his job if he goes to the police, while Derek plans to claim unfair dismissal and Alma cannot understand Mike's motives in giving her the lease.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gang of elderly villains spot a chance for one last, glorious crime spree when the villagers leave Aidensfield en masse to support Rob in a charity football match. Peg finally gives David a bit of support when it turns out his jury duty is more trouble than he imagined. Rural police drama, starring Sophie Ward, Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica discovers her former boss, who was previously jailed for murder, is in the dock again, accused of stabbing a man to death. His passionate pleas of innocence convince her he could be telling the truth, so she resolves to get to the bottom of the matter. Guest starring Spinal Tap's Michael McKean.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets Bert, a bouncy Great Dane puppy who is suffering growing pains, and needs surgery to prevent his front legs developing in an abnormal fashion. He also hears how caucasian shepherd dog Georgie is struggling to find a home due to her unusual appearance - her ears have been docked, giving her a scary look. Paul thinks a few website pictures might do the trick and calls on leading fashion photographer Rankin to help out. Finally, an injured Jack Russell is found by a council warden and rushed straight into surgery. Even if the operation is a success, can the dog hope to get over such a nasty experience?

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor becomes convinced something is wrong with him following a conversation with his mother, and Louisa's attempts at getting him to open up about the loss of his father prove futile. Mrs Tishell goes to the surgery for advice regarding a pain in her jaw, only to find herself falling in love with Martin all over again. Elsewhere, Al receives a visit from two military policemen who are trying to track down Mike Pruddy.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa decides to leave for Spain with baby James and says an awkward goodbye to Martin, but when he finds the scan of her brain, he spots a malformation and realises she could suffer a haemorrhage if she gets on the plane. Will the doctor make it to the airport in time? Meanwhile, Margaret reveals the real reason she has come to Portwenn, and disaster strikes at Bert and Jennifer's engagement party when Caroline receives an electric shock.

programme.title: Lewis

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple

Geraldine McEwan stars, with Juliet Stevenson, Denis Lawson and Alison Steadman.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: When a business magnate, his wife and their maid are murdered, Miss Marple (Julia McKenzie) is prompted by the circumstances surrounding the incidents to recall the nursery rhyme Sing a Song of Sixpence. She discovers the victims were part of a family tainted by secrets, and as she ponders the significance of the tune, a past scandal reveals itself. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a seemingly beloved resident of a coastal community is fatally driven off the road, and digs up the victim's past in the hope of unmasking the killer. Crime drama based on Ann Cleeves' series of novels, starring Brenda Blethyn.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Respected surgeon Dan Marsden is shot dead days before his retirement and his teenage daughters Mira and Karen are abducted. Joined by a new addition to the ranks, Vera investigates a mysterious parcel and a connection to the Iraq War as she races against time to catch the killer and save the girls. However, the case soon takes a violent and unexpected turn, striking at the heart of the team. Guest starring Saskia Reeves (Luther) and Dean Andrews (Ashes to Ashes), with Brenda Blethyn, David Leon and Gareth Farr.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve sees his solicitor about his court case. Victor is surprised at Derek's company report. Martin returns to work at the hospital.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jack grows suspicious of Vera `working late'. Derek starts looking for a job, Steve is scared that he's going to Borstal, while Sally finds it hard looking after all the children.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gang of youths push Peggy down a hole while she's poaching. Lord Ashfordly alerts Miller, who gives chase - but lands himself in trouble when he knocks down an elderly pedestrian. However, the incident gives Peggy a new money-making idea - she'll sue for the `injury' she sustained in the fall. Meanwhile, Gina is attracted to her handsome college tutor. Tim Brooke-Taylor and Murray Head guest star.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Cabot Cove's new physical fitness instructor is accused of murdering a con artist interested in property, presenting Jessica with a fresh mystery to solve. Angela Lansbury stars.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gang of elderly villains spot a chance for one last, glorious crime spree when the villagers leave Aidensfield en masse to support Rob in a charity football match. Peg finally gives David a bit of support when it turns out his jury duty is more trouble than he imagined. Rural police drama, starring Sophie Ward, Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale.

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail is thrilled that Mike is no longer her landlord. The McDonalds go to the magistrates' court, while Mavis asks Victor to give Derek his job back.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kevin realises he will lose his job if he goes to the police, while Derek plans to claim unfair dismissal and Alma cannot understand Mike's motives in giving her the lease.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.

programme.desc: Jessica discovers her former boss, who was previously jailed for murder, is in the dock again, accused of stabbing a man to death. His passionate pleas of innocence convince her he could be telling the truth, so she resolves to get to the bottom of the matter. Guest starring Spinal Tap's Michael McKean.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets Bert, a bouncy Great Dane puppy who is suffering growing pains, and needs surgery to prevent his front legs developing in an abnormal fashion. He also hears how caucasian shepherd dog Georgie is struggling to find a home due to her unusual appearance - her ears have been docked, giving her a scary look. Paul thinks a few website pictures might do the trick and calls on leading fashion photographer Rankin to help out. Finally, an injured Jack Russell is found by a council warden and rushed straight into surgery. Even if the operation is a success, can the dog hope to get over such a nasty experience?

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor becomes convinced something is wrong with him following a conversation with his mother, and Louisa's attempts at getting him to open up about the loss of his father prove futile. Mrs Tishell goes to the surgery for advice regarding a pain in her jaw, only to find herself falling in love with Martin all over again. Elsewhere, Al receives a visit from two military policemen who are trying to track down Mike Pruddy.

programme.title: Doc Martin

programme.desc: Jeff thinks he has found a rare vehicle - a Ferrari that mysteriously disappeared from the set of the hit TV show Miami Vice. US reality series following the exploits of ace motor dealer Jeff Allen and his team in Lubbock, Texas, known as the Flat 12.

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed and Emma visit the countryside to investigate rumours of a ghost seen in the private chapel of a long-dead duke supposedly killed in a mining disaster.

programme.title: Kojak
programme.desc: A detective with a drink problem looks likely to lose his badge, causing untold problems for Theo. Starring Telly Savalas.

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: The crime-busting coroner helps defend a college sports coach accused of indirectly causing the death of a potential Olympic champion. Drama, starring Jack Klugman.

programme.title: Minder
programme.sub-title: Give Us This Day Arthur Daley's Bread
programme.desc: Arthur employs a truck-load of ex-cons as cheap labour for his new landscape gardening business and things go swimmingly - until a series of thefts puts paid to the enterprise and he finds himself out of pocket. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole.

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: Guest stars Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise are entrusted to guard a consignment of heart pills by the girlfriend of the eminent research chemist developing the medicine. Before long, the comedy duo find themselves pursued by Middle Eastern operatives intent on procuring the new drug, as well as Sweeney officers who are trying to protect them. With John Thaw and Dennis Waterman.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: CI5 investigates the fatal shooting of a South American president's son at a polo match, and finds that the victim's step-sister is unknowingly dating one of the terrorists involved. Ruby Wax and Pierce Brosnan feature in early screen appearances, alongside stars Lewis Collins, Martin Shaw and Gordon Jackson.

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: A man-eating tiger is on the loose - but the big cat attack is just the first step in a plot to take over the country. Adventure, starring Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg.

programme.title: Kojak
programme.desc: When Theo breaks up a fight instigated by a crime lord's son, the thug puts out a contract on the detective's life. Telly Savalas stars.

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: A stash of Nazi loot, smuggled into Los Angeles inside an Egyptian mummy, puts the kiss of death on those who try to get their hands on it. Forensic drama, starring Jack Klugman and Robert Ito.

programme.title: Minder
programme.sub-title: Life in the Fast Food Lane
programme.desc: Arthur gets an illegal car phone, while Terry dates the wealthy daughter of a hamburger king who suddenly goes bankrupt. Vintage comedy drama, guest starring Patrick Malahide and Peter Capaldi alongside George Cole and Dennis Waterman.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie's schoolteacher girlfriend seeks CI5's assistance to quash a drug-smuggling ring after learning a 14-year-old pupil is involved having used then hidden a discarded firearm. The body count soon increases at an alarming rate as potential witnesses to a crime are killed off by the ruthless gang. Lewis Collins, Martin Shaw and Celia Gregory star.

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: An apparently respected gynaecologist's suitcase is stolen, but he is reluctant to reveal its contents. On further investigation the squad learns he was in the process of smuggling untaxed money out of the country and that a glamorous Latin woman with criminal connections, may hold the key to its whereabouts.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Bear's Mission
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls teaches the accomplished boxer some alternative survival skills. The duo start off on the notorious Commando Ridge in Cornwall, where the boxer has to climb granite rock, alpine traverses and sharp pinnacles. Next, Bear surprises AJ with a tricky descent - a major challenge for anyone nervous of heights - with a `death drop' on all sides. When it comes to nutrition, Bear unveils a rotted sheep's leg, advising Anthony they must eat the maggots while hacking in to get the marrow.

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: World heavyweight boxing champion Rocky Balboa settles down into a life of luxury - but a cloud appears on the horizon in the shape of ambitious contender Clubber Lang, whose brutal fighting style represents a serious threat to his title. Drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Mr T, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young, Carl Weathers and Hulk Hogan.

programme.desc: Henry Winkler, William Shatner, Terry Bradshaw, George Foreman and Jeff Dye start a new adventure in Munich, attempting to yodel and donning lederhosen for Oktoberfest.(n)

programme.desc: Bodie and Doyle's country holiday with their latest girlfriends spirals into chaos when they are held hostage in a farmhouse by two gunmen who have just botched a robbery. Adventure, with Gordon Jackson, Lewis Collins and Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An intruder begins breaking into people's homes and destroying their plaster statuettes of Napoleon, but leaving more valuable items untouched. Holmes resolves to find out why, eventually uncovering a twisted tale of theft and murder. Jeremy Brett stars as the master detective.(n)

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The mystery surrounding a legendary racehorse's disappearance is solved with the help of one of the most famous clues in the Holmes canon - `the curious incident of the dog in the night-time'. Victorian detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.desc: Oli Bell and Matt Chapman present a look ahead to the opening day of the flat season from Doncaster.(n)

programme.title: World of Sport: Footballing Upsets
programme.desc: Richard Henwood takes a look at past matches that provided surprising results, including Wimbledon's FA Cup final victory over Liverpool in 1988 - a staggering turn up for the books when the club with a non-league tradition beat the biggest powerhouse in English football.(n)

programme.title: Kojak
programme.desc: Theo investigates how his own camera came to be among a murdered man's possessions and gradually realises his nephew holds the key to the mystery. Telly Savalas, Neville Brand and Michael Mullins star.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: A Deadly State of Mind
programme.desc: A philandering psychiatrist, who involved his mistress in a series of hypnosis experiments, kills her husband in the heat of the moment when the pair are caught out. He persuades his distraught lover to make up a story involving two burglars, but Lt Columbo realises she is lying and goes in search of the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, George Hamilton and Lesley Warren.(n)

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani presents coverage of the opening day of the flat season at Doncaster, including the Unibet Lincoln (Heritage Handicap), which follows races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.00. Plus, races at 2.05. 2.40 and 3.15 from Kempton Park. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Kevin Blake, reports by Oli Bell, Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.(n)

programme.title: From Russia with Love
programme.desc: James Bond is sent to steal a top-secret Soviet decoding machine and ends up helping its operator defect to the West. However, he discovers the mission is really a trap set by international crime syndicate Spectre, and struggles to evade his would-be assassins. Spy thriller, starring Sean Connery, Robert Shaw, Daniela Bianchi and Lotte Lenya.(n)

With John Thaw and Dennis Waterman.

programme.title: The Professionals

programme.title: The Sweeney

programme.title: Bear's Mission

Next, Bear surprises AJ with a tricky descent - a major challenge for anyone nervous of heights - with a `death drop' on all sides. When it comes to nutrition, Bear unveils a rotted sheep's leg, advising Anthony they must eat the maggots while hacking in to get the marrow.

programme.title: Nelson in His Own Words
programme.desc: Horatio Nelson is one of Britain's greatest naval heroes and known for his thirst for fame and glory, but he was also a prolific writer of letters, which reveal that he was a very different and more complex man. programme.desc: Nils looks for a meteorite but the Black Elf is searching for it too.(n)

programme.title: Vic the Viking
programme.desc: Ulme finally meets someone who enjoys his singing - but it turns out to be a bear, who follows him home and eats all the food in the village.(n)

programme.title: Vic the Viking
programme.desc: A monster plots to ruin the winter festival by stealing all the children's presents.(n)

programme.title: Nils Holgersson
programme.desc: A storm stops the migration, but how do you lead a group of panicking geese through a hurricane?(n)

programme.title: Nils Holgersson
programme.desc: Martin takes charge of the flock. Nils looks to bring him down to earth as the responsibility goes to his head.(n)

programme.title: Nelson in His Own Words
programme.desc: Horatio Nelson is one of Britain's greatest naval heroes and known for his thirst for fame and glory, but he was also a prolific writer of letters, which reveal that he was a very different and more complex man. Using Nelson's personal correspondence, this drama-documentary shows how he was careful in his praise of his rivals in case they threatened his own career prospects, as well as revealing how his passionate love affair with Emma Hamilton changed his life for ever. With Jonathan Slinger.(n)

programme.title: The Guv'nor
programme.desc: A tramp finds that sharing a surname with a wealthy family is useful in getting himself out of trouble - but it ends up getting him in over his head when he is mistaken for a member of the family and appointed director of a bank. Comedy, starring George Arliss and Gene Gerrard.(n)

programme.title: London Live Sessions
programme.desc: Fickle Friends give an intimate performance at a London venue.(n)

programme.title: Trust Me, I'm a Doctor
programme.desc: Medical journalist Michael Mosley and a team of doctors offer advice on health, using their expertise and the latest research to investigate the truth behind various claims being made in the media. Surgeon Gabriel Weston takes part in an experiment at the University of Surrey's Sleep Research Centre to discover whether an extra hour in bed could have major benefits, while A&E specialist Dr Saleyha Ahsan asks if people can be overweight and still healthy, and tests the accuracy of two different methods used to assess fatness.(n)

programme.title: A Summer Story
programme.desc: A London lawyer falls for a simple farm girl during a hiking holiday on Dartmoor. Romantic drama set in turn-of-the-century England and based on John Galsworthy's The Apple Tree, with James Wilby, Imogen Stubbs, Jerome Flynn, Kenneth Colley and Susannah York.(n)

programme.title: Band Waggon
programme.desc: Two aspiring comedians decide to leave the BBC and start broadcasting pirate TV programmes from an old Scottish castle, unaware it is already being used by German spies. Comedy based on the popular radio series of the same name, starring Arthur Askey, Richard Murdoch and Jack Hylton.(n)

programme.title: Walks Around Britain
programme.desc: Andrew White and his team explore the British Isles, beginning with a challenging hike up Silver How in the Lake District and a walk through Fishlake in South Yorkshire.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Primary School
programme.desc: It's nearly the end of term at Gascoigne Primary School in Barking, east London, and Year 6 head Sarah Murphy must get sufficient children to meet basic SATs requirements before they leave, or the school risks a fresh Ofsted inspection. Ben is struggling to achieve the minimum Level 4, while Iliana is hoping to attain top marks and a place at grammar school. Meanwhile, Brandon, Zain and Tahha's battle for space to play football in the overcrowded playground leads to an accusation of racism.(n)

programme.title: Spotlight London
programme.desc: Interviews about arts and events showcasing London's vibrant culture scene.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A property expert offers advice to British householders aiming to buy a home abroad.(n)

programme.title: Frequencies
programme.desc: Scientists discover frequencies emitted by the human brain, that can be used to predetermine every aspect of their life. A student falls in love with a woman whose frequencies are different to his, meaning they should be incompatible - but he is determined to prove science wrong. Romantic sci-fi drama, starring Daniel Fraser and Eleanor Wyld.(n)

programme.title: London Live Sessions
programme.desc: Intimate performances by London's up-and-coming bands, featuring You Me at Six.(n)

programme.title: Age of Kill
programme.desc: A professional sniper is blackmailed into taking a new mission, which involves shooting six people in six hours. If he misses, reports the plot or is caught by the authorities, the terrorist behind the scheme promises to raise the death toll higher. Action thriller, starring Martin Kemp, Patrick Bergin and Bruce Payne.(n)

programme.title: Purely Belter
programme.desc: Two obsessive Newcastle United fans resolve to earn the £2,000 they need to get a season ticket apiece for their beloved Magpies - but personal problems dog their every attempt to raise the cash, meaning they may miss out on another season of soccer action. Comedy drama, starring Chris Beattie, Greg McLane, Tim Healy and Jody Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Collar of Duty
programme.desc: A border collie/husky mix named Kallie aids a teenage boy struggling with deep depression and is the muse for his career aspirations.

programme.title: Collar of Duty
programme.desc: A motor accident left Adam paralysed and he did not realise there was a void in his life until he got Gus, a chocolate Labrador who unintentionally became his service dog.

programme.title: Nigel Marven's Rhino Adventure
programme.desc: The naturalist sets out to film the five remaining species of rhino, beginning with the white variety in Africa, where many of the 12,000 animals are bought by farmers at auction as tourist attractions. Nigel also visits Umfolozi National Park in South Africa, a sanctuary for black rhinos, and turns his attention to the lesser-known Indian breed.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: The Brain with David Eagleman
programme.desc: A journey into the future, asking what is next for the human brain and how technological advances are poised to change individuals and society. Dr Eagleman meets a woman who had half her brain removed at the age of four and visits the Blue Brain Projects in Lausanne, Switzerland, where scientists are attempting to model a simulation of the working brain.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George Kourounis heads to the Arabian Desert to explore one of the most remote places on earth - the Empty Quarter. The vast, windswept area of trackless sand dunes stands in stark contrast to the glitzy and modern city of Dubai. The presenter sets off from Abu Dhabi on a four-week safari and makes it his mission to see both sides of the Arabian Peninsula.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Adventurer George Kourounis goes storm chasing in Oklahoma City, capital of America's `Tornado Alley'.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George Kourounis leads an expedition into a cave in Chihuahua, Mexico, that is filled with giant crystals - some more than 12 metres long. The location proves challenging to explore due to high temperatures and humidity approaching 100 per cent, meaning the team must wear refrigerated suits and respirators.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Radioactive Wolves
programme.desc: Film-makers and scientists follow packs of wolves living in Chernobyl's `dead zone' to discover what happens to wildlife after a nuclear accident.(n)

programme.title: Gorilla Family and Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Buchanan returns to the Democratic Republic of Congo in the hope of finding the gorilla family again, and discovering the outcome of silverback Chimanuka's confrontation with a rival. He soon finds the apes, but discovers their lives are now under threat from poachers, and works with the local rangers to prevent them coming to harm.(n)

programme.title: John Bishop's Australia
programme.desc: In 1992, the 25-year-old John Bishop rode a bicycle through Australia and back to Liverpool. But having spent all day on the road, he always felt he missed out on so much of the country he rode through. Now he returns to retrace his journey Down Under, using his original diary as a guidebook, meeting a range of extraordinary characters and experiencing true natural wonders. The comic begins by talking about his life back in the UK 22 years ago, and why he decided to set off on the journey in the first place, before he travels to Sydney and sets off up the east coast.(n)

programme.title: John Bishop's Australia
programme.desc: John Bishop continues his Aussie cycling trek, taking plenty of breaks along the way to sample the various delights the country has to offer. In the beach town of Byron Bay, New South Wales, he gets shown up by a gang of super-fit local lads and tries his hand at surfing, and then encounters giant saltwater crocodiles as he heads further north toward Queensland. In Rockhampton, the comedian goes cattle herding on horseback with the biggest beef baron in Australia, and it's no laughing matter when he gets a little too close to the action at a rodeo.(n)

programme.title: John Bishop's Australia
programme.desc: The comic pedals his way deep into tropical Australia, where he takes on an exhausting military test and rides a different type of bike to the one he's become used to as he goes motorcycling with Vietnam veterans. He also gets dirty down under while working on a banana farm, before the trip concludes with a breathtaking trip to the Great Barrier Reef, the Daintree rainforest and a surprising personal twist.(n)

programme.title: Ten Deadliest Snakes with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: The adventurous naturalist and snake lover comes face-to-face with some of the most lethal snakes in Malaysia.(n)

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Art
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the work of Johannes Vermeer, focusing on the hunt for the Dutch painter's missing masterpieces.

programme.title: Machines of War
programme.desc: The history of tanks, from the First World War to the most sophisticated modern armoured vehicles.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Lincoln's Inn, London: Called to the Bar
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew look for the remains of a 13th-century palace in Lincoln's Inn, London, a building that became the birthplace of the British legal system and was home to Henry III's Lord Chancellor. They also investigate Lincoln's Inn Fields, the biggest public square in central London. Over the course of three days, both sites produce glimpses of some of the defining events that have shaped the city's history.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to investigate a wide range of archaeological sites, and carry out a dig over a period of several days in the hope of unearthing items of cultural importance.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The story of an RAF pilot with incredible night vision, which supposedly came from eating carrots. Plus, rebels in the Philippines who believed they were fighting a vampire.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Lincoln's Inn, London: Called to the Bar
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew look for the remains of a 13th-century palace in Lincoln's Inn, London, a building that became the birthplace of the British legal system and was home to Henry III's Lord Chancellor. They also investigate Lincoln's Inn Fields, the biggest public square in central London. Over the course of three days, both sites produce glimpses of some of the defining events that have shaped the city's history.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to investigate a wide range of archaeological sites, and carry out a dig over a period of several days in the hope of unearthing items of cultural importance.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The story of an RAF pilot with incredible night vision, which supposedly came from eating carrots. Plus, rebels in the Philippines who believed they were fighting a vampire.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The stories behind the most important trains in history and their impact on the world, beginning with a look at the first locomotives during the Industrial Revolution.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: How Field Marshall Erich von Manstein's escape from the Red Army influenced Nato's defence plans.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The story of an RAF pilot with incredible night vision, which supposedly came from eating carrots. Plus, rebels in the Philippines who believed they were fighting a vampire.(n)

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Art
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the work of Johannes Vermeer, focusing on the hunt for the Dutch painter's missing masterpieces.(n)

programme.title: Machines of War
programme.desc: The history of tanks, from the First World War to the most sophisticated modern armoured vehicles.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Art
programme.desc: Works by Leonardo da Vinci that have been lost or stolen, including when the Mona Lisa was taken from the Louvre in Paris in 1911 - and Pablo Picasso was accused of the crime.(n)

programme.title: China's Megatomb: Secrets of the Terracotta Army
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the tomb of China's first Emperor and its army of Terracotta Warriors, revealing the macabre secrets that have challenged accepted historical records.(n)

programme.title: Prince John: The Windsors' Tragic Secret
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of King George V's youngest child, unravelling some of the mysteries and misconceptions surrounding him. Born in 1904, Prince John was diagnosed as epileptic and died at an early age - had he lived, he would have become the present Queen's uncle. Here, new research and photographic evidence are combined to build up a picture of his life.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Stonton Wyville, Leicestershire: Saxons on the Edge
programme.desc: An unassuming field near Stonton Wyville, Leicestershire, provides the team with a prize that has eluded them for 15 years. In a first for the programme, Tony Robinson and the team finally uncover the rarest of archaeological finds - an Anglo Saxon settlement and, in an attempt to discover the true origin of Britain's most famous Wessex Man, Phil Harding undergoes a DNA test to establish where his ancestors came from.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Hunstrete, Somerset: Keeping Up with the Georgians
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team descend on a field outside Bath to search for the remains of the Georgian house built 200 years previously by local MP Francis Popham. A set of stone arches is all that remains of the property, but two oil paintings suggest it was once one of the grandest homes in Britain - although the results of the dig tell a very different story.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Coberley, Gloucestershire: Mysteries of the Mosaic
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to a Cotswolds field, where they suspect the great and the good of Roman Britain once built their homes. However, an extensive dig reveals that the site was once a hub of worship for Bacchus, the pagan god of wine and entertainment, and its destruction was a result of iconoclasm practised by early Roman Christians.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Padstow, Cornwall: From Constantinople to Cornwall
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Padstow, Cornwall, to investigate why 1,500-year-old pottery and metalwork originating in North Africa and Turkey have been discovered by locals. The geophysics results suggest the field in which they were found may have contained an Iron Age village, while the archaeologists suspect the nearby sandy cove may have been a port dealing with traders from throughout the Mediterranean.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that `talk' to bees using electrical signals.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.(n)

programme.title: Monk

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: American social worker Sarah Goode is taken hostage by militants in northern Syria, and thanks to the efforts of the Navy Seals, is eventually returned home unharmed. Evidence from the incident suggests US citizen Kyle Nasry was connected to the kidnapping, but when the agents trace Nasry to a rally held by a controversial imam, they are surprised to find Sarah among the attendees. Meanwhile, DiNozzo finally takes his relationship with Zoe Keates public - surprising none of his colleagues. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Money Maker on the Merry-Go-Round
programme.desc: A gory discovery under a playground roundabout presents the team with a challenging reconstruction task. Investigating the murder of a young financial trader, Booth and Aubrey focus on a wealthy hedge fund, uncovering a world rife with drugs, escorts, incriminating evidence and multimillion-dollar mistakes. The case dredges up painful memories for Aubrey, while competitive intern Oliver Wells gets under Brennan's skin.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team springs into action when a famous crossword genius is found dead in a fracking pit, his body covered in acid. As Booth and Aubrey search for a motive, they learn the victim had a stalker, employed an overly ambitious assistant and made an enemy out of a disgruntled bookie, but a further discovery makes the case much more complicated. Meanwhile, the newest member of the Jeffersonian family looks set to arrive sooner than expected when Daisy's waters break in the lab.

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A murder case leads Jane into conflict with charismatic cult leader Bret Stiles, whom he first met while investigating the death of a media mogul. The consultant is surprised when his antagonist offers him information regarding the identity of serial killer Red John, and the location of missing psychic Kristina Frye. Guest starring Malcolm McDowell (Heroes), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and his colleagues investigate when Eric Kutzler, the first openly gay Navy lieutenant tipped to receive the Medal of Honour, is murdered. While the agents initially suspect Kutzler's death was the result of a hate crime, the fact that his police officer husband waited 20 minutes to report the crime suggests he had something to hide. Meanwhile, the team throws a baby shower for Palmer as his wife's due date approaches. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Garbage Strike
programme.desc: San Francisco's refuse collectors go on strike, plunging Adrian into a frenzy of loathing as rubbish begins piling up in the streets - and making it hard for him to concentrate on solving the murder of a union official. Unable to think rationally, he becomes convinced a rock star is the killer. Guest starring Alice Cooper as himself, and Chi McBride (Pushing Daisies).

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Mutilation of the Master Manipulator
programme.desc: When the remains of a professor are found scattered around town, straight-talking Brennan and sarcastic junior agent Aubrey are forced into an unlikely partnership, with Booth busy doing a traffic course. The pair discover the victim was conducting experiments at home that had deep psychological effects on his participants, but when they also uncover a string of student lovers, they are faced with countless suspects.

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A man convicted of murder and rape is released from jail because of faulty DNA evidence and subsequently killed, prompting Jane and the team to investigate his death. However, it soon becomes apparent that more than one person wanted revenge on him. Guest starring Jack Coleman (Heroes), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo investigates a murder at the military academy he once attended, after a murdered marine and alumni of the school is found clutching a photo of a current student. Meanwhile, Bishop and her husband invite the team out for a special dinner. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects Gibbs's arch-nemesis is behind an explosion at a summit on global terror. Meanwhile, a grief-stricken Fornell struggles to deal with the fatal shooting of his ex-wife. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Pauley Perrette and Joe Spano.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: After a malnourished and confused nine-year-old is found hiding in a storage unit, NCIS reopens an old missing persons case when the girl is believed to be the daughter of a Navy recruit who disappeared a decade earlier. Bishop discovers notes that Special Agent Ziva David kept on the case. Mark Harmon stars.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: New York's City's chief medical examiner, Julia Martin is charged with tampering evidence on the case that made her career. Bull wants to mount a defence selling to the Jury that Martin may have made a mistake. Michael Weatherly stars.

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan resolves to spend more father-son time with Steve, and the pair start bowling together, a pass-time at which the awkward teen proves to be quite gifted.

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan hopes to avoid conducting a suicide mission by beating Bullock in a DJ battle, and Jeff dreams up a new musical instrument after drinking psychedelic tea.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: The Father, the Son and the Holy Fonz
programme.desc: Peter decides to start a new religion dedicated to his favourite Happy Days character, the Fonz, but finds it hard to recruit members. Meanwhile, a mishap leaves a disgruntled Stewie stuck in a bubble.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A brush with death gives Brian a new lease of life, which he capitalises on by becoming a singer and performing with Frank Sinatra Jr. Meanwhile, Meg finally finds acceptance by pretending to be a lesbian.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan resurrects President Garfield to teach Hayley about history, and Steve starts writing for his school's newspaper. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Bullock is disappointed when someone neglects to bring a present to the CIA Secret Santa Party, and Stan resolves to find out which of his colleagues has turned Scrooge.(n)

programme.title: Stan Against Evil
programme.desc: Evie attempts to rescue Stan's prized possession, his Bobby Orr hockey stick, from the church donation pile, only to find herself transported into the spirit world. Comedy horror, starring John C McGinley and Janet Varney.(n)

programme.title: Stan Against Evil
programme.desc: A strange crop of flowers starts growing in town, with each bloom bringing a new supernatural horror. Evie attempts to summon Stan's dead wife, Claire, to help her stop them. Comedy horror, starring John C McGinley and Janet Varney.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois thinks Stewie is trying to kill her because he is not spending enough time with his father. She tells Peter to make an effort to bond with the youngster - but a theme park outing ends in disaster.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois discovers that she has an estranged brother, and combs the country in search of him, eventually finding him in a psychiatric hospital. Meanwhile, Peter starts a society for fat men. Animation, featuring the guest voice of Robert Downey Jr.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois fulfils a lifelong ambition by becoming a model, much to the displeasure of Peter and her father. Meanwhile, Brian works for Stewie's marketing company to pay for the treatment of an embarrassing problem.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian embarks on a relationship with a teacher, causing him to neglect Peter - who responds by befriending actor James Woods instead. Meanwhile, Stewie becomes so agitated by The Da Vinci Code that he is unable to sleep.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: A young teacher faces prosecution for falsifying test results, and she appeals to Bull for legal aid, claiming she only changed the score to help a student reach their potential.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth's excitement about the possibility of moving to Berlin is dampened by a mysterious phone call offering information on an important case. However, the caller is found dead before the agent is able to get to him, and when the victim is identified as a conspiracy blogger who had been working undercover as a janitor at a security company, his murder indicates he was on to something. As Booth investigates, he encounters secretive judges and obstructive procedures, so decides to branch out on his own to learn if there's something sinister going on inside the FBI - but the situation takes a dangerous turn. David Boreanaz directs and stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Navy commander's wife, determining whether it is linked to her role as a therapist, or an act of terrorism since her husband's name has appeared on a Jihadist's target list. Elsewhere, the group discusses Halloween costumes, as well as Tony's recent dating habits. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Police believe a college student was the latest victim of Red John, prompting Kristina Frye to make a televised appeal for the elusive murderer to come forward. Remembering how his own TV appearance led to the death of his family, a furious Jane tries to protect the self-proclaimed psychic - only to discover the serial killer may be one step ahead of him. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker, with Leslie Hope (24).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers a fraudulent charity that preys on those searching for missing military personnel while investigating the murder of a retired Master Sergeant. Meanwhile, Bishop agonises over the results of her probation evaluation, and Tony contemplates adopting a stray cat that followed him home. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The long-running crime drama returns with Booth languishing in prison, having been wrongly charged with the murders of three colleagues. Surrounded by cons he helped put behind bars, the agent tries to keep his spirits up, while Brennan and the team work tirelessly to exonerate him. Meanwhile, Sweets and Daisy announce they are going to have a baby.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the cause of a hit-and-run incident in which a Petty Officer has been killed. Meanwhile, Gibbs works to clear a Navy Hospital Corpsman who has been indicted for illegally providing medical aid to victims of the crash, despite the injured insisting her techniques helped save their lives. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is unsure of his future with the California Bureau of Investigation following his confrontation with serial killer Red John. Police chief Gale Bertram calls on the consultant's help when a prominent lawyer and Statehouse lobbyist is kidnapped, but finds him reluctant to join the investigation. Crime drama, guest starring Michael Gaston (Jericho), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Following the death of one of their own, the grieving team sets out to uncover who's responsible, with a guilty Booth obsessed with solving the case. When a link is discovered with his framing for murder, Special Agent James Aubrey is brought in to help investigate - uncovering a conspiracy within the Federal Government that dates all the way back to J Edgar Hoover. Crime drama, starring Emily Deschanel and David Boreanaz, with John Boyd (24).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An enigmatic killer shoots dead a businessman spending Thanksgiving at a hotel in the city, then takes his glasses, jewellery and ID to Washington Dulles airport, which has been brought to a stand-still by a massive snowstorm. As the murderer's actions take effect, a terror alert is issued, leaving all northern US airports in a state of panic, and leaving it up to DiNozzo, Bishop and her husband - all of whom are trapped at Dulles by the weather - to bring the armed villain to justice. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherley.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is forced to help his estranged brother-in-law, who has become embroiled in a murder investigation. Despite his reservations, the consultant joins the case, but is forced to face his dubious past and encounters a number of old acquaintances. Crime drama, guest starring Kevin Rankin (Bionic Woman), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee deals with his father's recent death by writing him a letter outlining the details of his latest investigation. The case involved tracking down a hactivist collective known as Krampus, who were thought to have been responsible for an incident in which the internet crashed all over Washington, DC. McGee and Abby brought in three known cyber-terrorists for questioning, and discover evidence that links the trio to an attempted breach of the Congress e-mail server and archive. However, when this line of inquiry reaches a dead-end, the team picks up a new lead that suggests an isolated hacker from Wisconsin may be responsible. This `lone wolf' scenario does not seem plausible to McGee, though, as he recalls a lesson his late father taught him. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates an apparent copycat murder of an unsolved case from 150 years earlier, which spawned a legendary ghost story in the city. Gregorio is unnerved when the case becomes connected to a recent seance and a local medium. Crime drama, starring Scott Bakula and Vanessa Ferlito.(n)

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: Lucifer attempts to control his emotions when he learns the flaming sword is the only way the family can return home. In the meantime, a therapist and head of admissions at a prestigious private school is found dead. Fantasy drama, starring Tom Ellis.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Another power cut gives Peter the opportunity to regale the family with a second Star Wars-themed story, this time based on Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back. programme.desc: The story of the American rock band, who emerged from the counterculture of the 1960s with a diverse, eclectic style that fused myriad musical genres.(n)

programme.title: Music Icons

programme.title: Brian Johnson's A Life on the Road

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries

Drama, starring Yannick Bisson as a 19th-century Canadan detective.(n)

programme.title: Rizzoli & Isles
programme.desc: The squad works on what turns out to be a particularly dangerous case after a late-night amateur drag race turns deadly, and while the motive for murder may have been an attempt to conceal drug trafficking Jane also senses that Martinez is deliberately hindering the investigation. Crime drama, starring Angie Harmon and Amaury Nolasco.(n)

programme.title: Rush
programme.desc: Melbourne's water is contaminated by a woman who believes fluoride in the supply is the cause behind her husband's death. Meanwhile Stella clashes with the team as they wait for the ballistics report and Michael's faith is tested when he loses a large sum of money.(n)

Kris Marshall stars.(n)

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: A man is murdered during a burlesque performance at the Star Room theatre, where Murdoch, Odgen and Brackenreid are surprise to discover a familiar face in the audience.(n)

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective's wife is shot, and Brackenreid, Crabtree, Higgins and Jackson's investigation reveals the culprit may have been one of her former patients.(n)

programme.title: Rizzoli & Isles

programme.title: Rush
programme.desc: Christian is thrilled to be in charge of guarding his childhood idol the Tuvaluan Prime Minister, but the dangerous reality kicks in when it becomes clear he is a target for assassination. Meanwhile, Lawson dashes Dom's hopes of returning to the team.(n)

programme.desc: A skeleton uncovered in the foundations of a swimming pool is identified as a young lottery winner named Cheryl, who was reported missing 17 years ago. programme.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries

programme.desc: Audrey becomes upset when Jeff is too engrossed in a game of basketball to congratulate her on a promotion, so he buys her tickets to a match to make up for it. Meanwhile, Jennifer and Adam argue over money.(n)

programme.desc: Joe is forced to quickly make a decision that could affect his and Mel's marriage after his new wife drops a bombshell at the ceremony. Meanwhile, Lennox is caught between Zander and Marco, and Ryder struggles to find the right time to make an announcement about college.(n)

programme.desc: Sheldon tries to extend his lifespan, concerned he will not be around long enough for his consciousness to be downloaded into a robot body, and the friends encounter Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak (guest starring as himself) at the Cheesecake Factory.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.desc: Holt and Peralta contract mumps during an investigation, so the pair elect to be quarantined together in the hope that they can use the time to solve the case. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's mother comes to visit and woos the gang, but he cannot help feeling jealous of all the attention she is receiving - until a bout of illness lays him low, and he suddenly sees the benefits of having her around. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.desc: Leonard has doubts about his feelings for Priya when he kisses a girl he meets in the comic-book store, while the rest of the friends play pranks on Sheldon in celebration of Halloween. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

Beverly keeps calling Erica at college, but Erica wants some space from her mother and screens her phone calls, forcing Beverly to adopt drastic measure.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon uses his holidays to help Amy in her biology lab, but moans about the menial jobs he is given - until she asks him to dissect a brain. Penny grows curious about Leonard's attitude to marriage when Bernadette asks Howard to sign a pre-nuptial agreement.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny bond as they miss Leonard, and Howard tries to help Raj get over his break-up with Lucy. Meanwhile, Bernadette and Amy visit an out-of-town conference. Comedy about four high-achieving scientists, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star.(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: An LAPD cop discovers a psychotic criminal has planted a bomb on a crowded bus, primed to go off if the vehicle drops below 50mph. He boards the vehicle and helps a hapless passenger who has been forced to take the wheel and keep a constant speed to avoid a disaster. Action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Sandra Bullock, Dennis Hopper and Jeff Daniels.(n)

programme.title: Rick and Morty

However, when Jerry, Beth and Summer use Rick's inter-dimensional goggles to view themselves in parallel timelines, it has a bad effect on family relationships.(n)

programme.title: Robot Chicken
