programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: A restaurateur reluctantly agrees to give evidence against corrupt police officers who savagely beat a witness, but they respond by framing her for murder. Thriller, starring Mary Tyler Moore, Edward Asner, Denis Arndt and Fredric Lane.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part two of two. John searches for a missing soldier, Jim Bob is attacked by a grieving father, and the family receives distressing news from the front line.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin comes to stay with the family, bringing her grandchildren, and becomes determined to make Olivia's life easier.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A snowstorm strikes as the Ingalls make their way home after a trip to Mankato, and they struggle to survive in a remote mountain cabin with little food.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Johnny Johnson drops out of school hoping to see the world, but his first adventure only gets him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The locals celebrate the founding of Walnut Grove, but the contests held to mark the occasion bring out a competitive streak in the Ingalls and Oleson families.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: The Richest Man in Walnut Grove
programme.desc: Charles and his boss anticipate a large income from a big job. However things fail to go according to plan, which puts a financial strain on the family as they pull together to make ends meet.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. John-Boy receives an offer from a publishing house just as the house is nearly destroyed in a fire - and his manuscript is lost in the blaze.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy prepares to publish the first edition of his newspaper, and is tempted to report on a political scandal when he witnesses the mayor crash his car.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The doctor is unable to make ends meet and plans to leave town, just as Grandma's health takes a turn for the worse.(n)

programme.title: Too Young to Marry
programme.desc: When high school students Jessica and Max announce they plan to marry, their decision is met with objections from friends and family who feel they're rushing into things. The couple remain determined to carve out a successful life for themselves, but when Jessica is accepted at Harvard University, she faces a dilemma. Romantic drama, starring Nina Dobrev and Dillon Casey.(n)

programme.title: The Trip To Bountiful
programme.desc: An elderly widow longs to pay a final visit to her childhood home before she dies. However, her plan is hindered by her concerned son, who refuses to either accompany her or let her travel alone, forcing her to make ever more desperate attempts to escape the suburbs and embark on her nostalgic journey. Drama, starring Cicely Tyson and Vanessa Williams.(n)

programme.title: All Roads Lead to Rome
programme.desc: A teacher is reunited with her ex-boyfriend while staying in an Italian village. The former lovers are forced to work together when her teenage daughter and his 80-year-old mother steal a car and run away to Rome together, the former hoping to return home to her boyfriend and the latter planning to remarry against her son's wishes. Romantic comedy, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Raoul Bova and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

programme.title: Sporting Records
programme.desc: A look at some of the greatest milestones ever recorded in sport, focussing on the age-related accomplishments of Pele, Bernard Hopkins and Marc Marquez. Pele made a name for himself when he represented Brazil in the 1958 FIFA World Cup, becoming the youngest player to appear in the tournament when aged 17 years and 249 days. Hopkins held multiple world boxing titles, and continued his professional career into his 50s, while Marquez became the youngest rider to win the MotoGP World Championship when he claimed his first title in 2013.

programme.title: Little Divas: Tantrums & Tiaras
programme.desc: Light-hearted documentary shedding light on the lives of people whose extravagant tastes often leave their parents or significant others substantially out of pocket. These so-called `divas' are more than willing to throw tantrums, manipulate relatives and resort to emotional blackmail to get what they want. Among the pampered persons highlighted are shopping-obsessive Janey, who withholds sex from her fiancé as a means of getting access to his bank account, and ambitious teen Romy, who demands her mother supply her with a `big budget' wardrobe to match her big dreams. Also featured is apprentice hairdresser Matthew, who plans to emulate the camp excess of Lady Gaga as a performer, much to the dismay of long-suffering boyfriend Dylan.(n)

programme.title: Wild France with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray explores the geography, flora and fauna of six areas of France, beginning by visiting Vanoise National Park in the Rhone-Alpes region of the south-east of the country. His journey sees him forage in alpine meadows, herd goats, track ibex and spot playful marmots, before he treks to the top of a mountain in search of the bearded vulture - one of the rarest birds in Europe.(n)

programme.title: Wild France with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray continues his exploration of the geography, flora and fauna of France by heading to the Ardeche, where miles of gorges and limestone cliffs characterise this part of the Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes region. He visits a cave with a long history and is given special permission to abseil in through the original sky-facing entrance, finding an array of stalactites and stalagmites inside. He then canoes down the Ardeche river and meets wildlife ranger Olivier, who teaches him some of the traditional uses of local plants.(n)

programme.title: Wild France with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray travels to the Camargue in the south of the country, a vast wetland that includes ancient salt pans, huge expanses of river delta, inland salt-water lakes and reed beds. He meets the French cowboys known as gardians who have made it their home and watches as they use their skills to round up powerful bulls, and he also discovers how salt influences the ecology of the area.(n)

programme.title: Wild France with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray visits the Cevennes National Park in southern France, one of the country's most uninhabited regions. He meets Laurent, a farmer whose family have grown chestnut trees for generations, before setting up a campfire to cook some of the nuts to make soup. He then chats to a beekeeper who builds traditional hives from tree trunks, and then he heads off in search of wolves - an animal that was once common in this area - and learns how vultures have been successfully reintroduced to the region.(n)

programme.title: Wild France with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray explores the geography, flora and fauna of Provence in the south-east of the country, visiting its ochre canyons and heading off to a gorge to look for the rare Bonelli's eagle. Ray also uses his tracking skills to find a whole family of wild boar.(n)

programme.title: Wild France with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray travels to the west of Brittany to explore the rugged coastline and heading out by boat to its nearby islands. On his journey, he has a close encounter with bottlenose dolphins when they swim up to the vessel and also visits a seal colony and meets seaweed fishermen before heading back to shore. By the rocks, he discovers peregrines that have build their nest dangerously close to land, while Ray heads down to the beach to look for shellfish with a local expert and learns about Brittany's high tides.(n)

Digging at a stately home, the team finds plenty of evidence of the American troops' training including the rooms where they were billeted, unchanged since 1944. programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether aliens that once visited Earth deliberately left a series of clues that mankind was eventually meant to decipher. Many ancient sites, and even recent ones like Roswell, all seem to be associated with reports of something coming down from the sky. Tsoukalos' research demonstrates that many of these places share a common symbol or shape-concentric circles. What is the significance of these designs, and is it possible they contain a coded message left by alien visitors?(n)
